pageContext.claim: “China is doing very, very poorly. They've had -- I just saw a report -- they've had the worst year they've had in 27 years because of what I've done. And they want to come to the negotiating table. You know, they're having companies lose -- I mean, they're leaving. The companies are leaving. And they're laying off millions of people because they don't want to pay 25 percent [tariffs].”
pageContext.analysis: This is highly misleading, as there is little to no evidence supporting Trump's claim that China has lost millions of jobs due to the trade war with the United States or his claim that U.S. tariffs are spurring large-scale company closures in China.
